description: The round payoff this round was 4. You, John chose to play option 2.Kate chose to play option 1. You received a payoff of 4.

The game is set up as a delicate balance between safe and aggressive moves. Choosing option 1 guarantees a neutral outcome when both do so, whereas selecting option 2 can earn you the round input as a reward if the opponent sticks with option 1—but it comes with the high risk that if both choose option 2, you both suffer a dramatically amplified loss

Deepseek‐R1 (Kate) is programmed by default to choose option 1, which, as evidenced by the 2024‑01‑02 round (where John’s option 2 produced a +4 payoff when Kate played option 1), leaves her vulnerable to exploitation. This means that as John you can potentially secure a positive payoff by deviating when you know she will play the safe option.

There is a strategic meta-layer to the game since both players have access to each other’s APIs. This transparency means that while Kate’s default is safe, she might alter her behavior if she deduces your strategy, and vice versa, leading to a potentially evolving battle of anticipation and adaptation
